summary:
As a kid, I wanted to be a bulldozer operator. It happens that nearly every year before summer, a bulldozer would come to repair the unpaved road near the grandparents' farm where I spend a lot of my childhood. Fast-forward, from chores and being fascinated with a big machine, to building my own toys, the bruisers, and the fun that came with it, it is 2005. After learning pseudocode, Pascal, C and DBMS, as part of Information Technology class, I am deciding which university degree to pursue. Building GUIs with Visual Basic, making animations with Macromedia Flash or knowing about relational databases or programming is fun but perhaps not per se. Building tangible things, machines, automation, and CAD seemed fascinating and fulfilling as a career path. Thus, in 2005 I started Mechanical Engineering after being accepted at the University of Aveiro, Portugal. In 2011, I completed my M.Sc. dissertation in computer vision at the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering and Robotics at AGH University, Poland. In the 10+ years that followed, I have worked in the development of a particle physics detector (PANDA), as a materials researcher in polymer nanocomposites (TheLink, Promolding B.V. and NovAM - TU Delft). And, as senior R&D engineer in building-integrated photovoltaics (BIPV) modules (EXASUN B.V.). 

My technical skills include CAD (CATIA v5, SolidWorks), FEM analysis (ANSYS Mechanical, Thermal, CFX, CST Studio, COMSOL Multiphysics and Moldex3D), MATLAB (Instrument Control, Image Processing Toolbox), Avizo, computer vision (OpenCV, HALCON) and data analysis with Python 3 / Jupyter Notebooks. As a material researcher, I enjoy solving problems related to materials/processes. Thus, extensive material testing/characterization, data analysis/plotting, literature review and publishing peer review research articles are part of my experience. In my current job, I have worked as lead engineer for the development of a solar cell pick-and-place machine. And as lead certification engineer for the IEC certification of an entire portfolio of BIPV modules. 
 
I perceive myself as dedicated, structured, helpful, and capable of solving problems independently. I take ownership seriously, and I always have a strong sense of responsibility within the teams and projects that I am involved. My multidisciplinary skills, curiosity, sense of achievement and willingness to continue working and developing, together with the prospects of a better career path, makes me naturally motivated and dependable. I like a no-nonsense and down-to-earth approach to work and interact with colleagues.

profile_positions.description: Research, design, build and test of clinical and pre-clinical (medical) devices.
profile_positions.title: R&D Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Worked as lead project engineer for the machine building of a solar-cell PnP. Major outcomes: Increased throughput by 5 to 6 times. Reduced process pains and low-need for human supervision.
   - Supervised a senior software developer. Informal management and delegation of tasks related to hardware, software, automation and electrical installation.
   - Programmed vision scripts for real-time image analysis, quality control, cell/ECA-dot detection and precise cell positioning. Offline EL image analysis for QA.
- Worked as lead certification engineer for the IEC certification of PV modules. Contributed to the factory-audit process. Major outcomes: Successful certification of several products that served as go-decision to establish a partnership with an exclusive distributer present in 33 EU countries.
   - Worked on content development/technical writing: Wrote installation guidelines, TDSs, product nameplates, flow-diagrams, process-flow. And helped to structure and maintain the product BOM/DB.     
- Worked together with procurement to define material requirements, quality criteria, meet with supplier and discuss non-conformities.
- Implement, introduce, trouble shoot, and/or improve manufacturing processes.
- Worked on actively identifying, exploring, researching and advising on new and existing materials and technologies.
- Wrote technical reports, operation manuals, procedures and QA reports documenting several aspects related to material testing, production instructions, product quality and safety testing, machine operation and testing procedures. 
-Reviewed technical drawings/GD&T. Worked on concept designs to demonstrate solutions for product redesign and improvement.
- Performed literature review, research, data analysis, root cause analysis and wrote reports related to product or manufacturing pain points.
- Provided advice and ideas to younger colleagues and management while always striving to share knowledge and empower in a informal and approachable way.
profile_positions.title: Senior R&D Engineer

company.name: TheLink Research Network / Promolding B.V. / TU Delft - Novel Aerospace Materials Group

profile_positions.company: TheLink Research Network / Promolding B.V. / TU Delft - Novel Aerospace Materials Group
profile_positions.description:
My research focus on the processing, morphological and electrical characterization of conductive / semi-conductive polymer composites aiming at enhanced EMI shielding properties.

- This research is performed within the TheLink a EU founded research and training network, Promolding B.V. and Novel Aerospace Materials Group - TU Delft. TheLink is comprised by 10 partners, 7 countries and 15 researchers.

- The research focus on studying correlations between the composites thermomechanical history, their ultimate morphology and the electrical properties (conductivity, charge storage, EMI shielding effectiveness). 

- Polymer micro- and nano-composites were developed using melt compounding, injection and compression moulding of carbon based fillers. 

- Carbon nanotubes, graphene, graphite, carbon black, within others, conductive polymer composites were studied using semi-crystalline, amorphous and thermoplastic elastomers.  

- Foamed polymer composites were produced aiming enhanced specific properties and studied with focus on the electrical property-determining-structures.

- Factors such as the fillers particle aspect ratio, filler concentration, filler dispersion, synergistic effects of multi-filler and multi-phase composites, conductivity - crystallinity, flow-induced filer orientation, weld-lines, compounding settings, injection moulding parameters, within others, were studied.

- The main goal of this industrial research is to gain new knowledge and skills and to establish rules on the processing of conductive polymer composites that allow to achieve the best output in electromagnetic interference (EMI) shielding, electrostatic discharge (ESD) and mechanical properties on a set of composites samples produced by injection moulding. 

- The ultimate goal of this research is to bring significant improvements on the process and resulting products that aim to take full advantage of the potential benefits inherent to carbon-based conductive polymer composites.
profile_positions.title: Researcher on Conductive Polymer Nanocomposites

company.name: Institute for Nuclear Physics, Johannes Gutenberg Universität Mainz

profile_positions.description: To give continuation to the work previously developed for the PANDA (Anti-Proton Annihilation at Darmstadt) Experiment (https://panda.gsi.de/oldwww/) I got hired by the Institut für Kernphysik-University of Mainz in close collaboration with the Helmholtz Institut Mainz (https://www.him.uni-mainz.de/).
profile_positions.title: R&D Mechanical Engineer at PANDA Experiment

company.name: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

profile_positions.company: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research
profile_positions.description:
My work was performed within a group of physicists and engineers focused on the R&D of a particles-physics detector called PANDA (http://www-panda.gsi.de/).
My main tasks included: 
-> 3D CAD of an electromagnetic colorimeter sub-detector for PANDA. For this task I used CATIA v5 for 3D CAD, GD&T and exploded-view drawings.
-> Fluid-solid-interactions (FSI) parametric simulations using Catia v5 and ANSYS (Workbench, Design Modeler, CFX-Pre, CFD-Post). I also attended two training courses on ANSYS Workbench (4days) and ANSYS CFX (2days) at CADFEM Aadorf(CH). And invested many days studying ANSYS docs and performing other FEM analysis (mechanical, thermal, welded joints and bolt-pretension). 
-> Design of 2 molds to produce CFRP parts known as "CF-alveoli". Including: 1) Design of 3 less expensive molds CNC-machined in house to test initial molding concept; 2) Design and GD&T of two new improved molds with better dimensional accuracy; 3) Commissioning of tools and FPL-etched Al-inserts.
-> Production of CFRP parts: 1) Procurement of different CF prepregs (different fabrics, tow number and elasticity modules); 2) Backing of c.a. 30 composite parts to evaluate the molding procedure (mold cleaner, mold release agent, prepreg wrapping, curing cycle and production of parts for mechanical tests. 3) Test adhesive/graphite mixtures for improved TC. 4) Mechanical loading and thermal-cycling tests. 5) Matrix-fiber interface SEM analysis. 5) Tools and part dimensional inspection.  
-> Worked on several other projects: Design of BFRP parts, design of light-scintillators with PTMs, selection of materials (adhesives, thermal management materials, release and molding agents, brazing alloys, optical fibers), design of customized multi-optical-fiber ferrules, fabrication of thin-PT100 sensors, selection of HV modules, design of high-density feedthrough connectors for signals and power services, prototyping and testing, design of polymeric parts produced by SLS and FDM, within others.
profile_positions.title: R&D Mechanical Engineer at PANDA Experiment
